website_summaries.verdict: People are mostly happy with what the Ravenna 11 has to offer. This running shoe is deemed efficient at delivering steadiness for overpronators. The outsole traction and breathable upper are highlighted as accommodating elements. For daily, speedy runs, the Ravenna 11 guarantees an efficient performance and a responsive ride.Still, fans of road running shoes that are meant for the correction of pronation are likely to gravitate towards the Brooks Ravenna 11.
pros: Some comments have emphasized that the non-bulky stability feature offers support without being too cumbersome
Breathability is an aspect that runners appreciate with the Brooks Ravenna 11
This stability running shoe is welcomed because it doesn’t have a bulky look
The collar of the Ravenna 11 is lauded for effectively securing the heel and keeping it from wobbling
The gripping capacity of the outsole is welcomed by those who have tested this running shoe
cons: A couple of testers believe that the ends of the GuideRails® support system are digging into the arch
The midfoot part of the upper restricts the shape and motion of the foot, based on some comments

customer_reviews.title: 2020 model is not a reliable shoe
customer_reviews.text: My son has loved Brooks shoes but this years model is a fail for him. The first pair was purchased on June 21. The wear and tear by July 15th was so shocking that I just figured it was a defective shoe. Purchased two more and 4 weeks later both pairs are worn out. Last years model shoe averaged 300 miles, this years less than 200. He used alternating pairs and ran the exact same areas as last year. Will not be buying this shoe again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weaker Materials
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed. I've run in Ravenna 9s and 10s. I've only been walking in my Ravenna 11s for a month or two and have experienced tear out in the heels on 2 pairs. I think the heel material is weaker and thinner than in previous versions of this shoe. I was excited when I first got these shoes because they were more stylish than they've been in the past and retained my heel better than the Ravenna 10s. This ability to trap a heel better might be part of the problem with the 11s. My recommendation is to save your money and not buy the Ravenna 11s.
customer_reviews.author: RewK

customer_reviews.title: Fit smaller than usual.
customer_reviews.text: Usually like revennas but for some reason this one fits differently.
customer_reviews.author: Nestor Villafane

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, need better laces
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are great. The elastic shoe laces leave a bit to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Driscoll

customer_reviews.title: Little tight
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable shoes. Ordered the same size as my last pair and these are much tighter. Had to go with thinner socks. Other than that, I am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Maldev

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Switched from the Adrenaline’s, another Brooks support running shoe. The Ravennas are so much better if you don’t need tons of support. They are comfy and lightweight, and aren’t too springy or dense. Arch support is just right for my low arches. My run times have already improved since they’re so lightweight compared to the Adrenaline’s. Fits the same as my Adrenaline’s, too. Don’t recommend buying online though unless you know your size in Brooks running shoes. Better off buying in a store first then re-ordering online for convenience.
customer_reviews.author: John Mayers

customer_reviews.title: Defective materials, manufacturing.
customer_reviews.text: Have worn brooks for a few years had Ravenna 10’s that we’re ok only lasted a little over a year. Even then I had to glue the sole that comes up over the toe down. And the soles themselves wore out in a little over a year. I had a pair of Adrenaline GTS15 for a couple years. Now the Ravenna 11’s I have had since Sept. 26 2020 not even 3 months and the left heel is gone. Seems to be a recurring problem. What’s with brooks? Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: H. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Eyelets are wideset and hard
customer_reviews.text: The shoe appears to be of good quality, but I found the eyelets to be much more wideset than the 2 pairs of Pure Flow 6 I have. The eyelet itself is hard and rests on top of the joint of the big toe and overtime caused me some discomfort when running (hence my rating). I still wear the shoes for short everyday outings but not for running which was their intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Solid training shoes
customer_reviews.text: My son is on a high school cross so he puts 500 miles in few months. This was his 4th pair so far no injuries since he switched to these shoes. They have a nice bounce to them and lots of support.
customer_reviews.author: Rupert Young

customer_reviews.title: Great runner, but fit is different from previous model
customer_reviews.text: Great looking trainer, lighter and fit was ok. Took a few runs to get the lacing configuration and fit on feet right. Fit is slightly different, last pair I was able to throw on and just run. Much happier in them now that I wave had a few runs in them.
customer_reviews.author: Alexiis Ravenhall

product_meta.title: Brooks Men's Ravenna 11 Running Shoe
product_meta.description: Reactive cushioning with BioMoGo DNA cushioning midsole and sprung rubber that provide an elastic feeling under the feet. The midfoot transition zone is designed to make you move from heel to toe quickly. The lightweight perforated mesh upper gives your fingers room for breathability. The Diagonal Rollbar provides extra support for smoother heel-toe transitions. A reflective band wraps the middle part of the foot to ensure a secure fit.
feature_bullets: THIS SHOE IS FOR: The Ravenna 11 is perfect for runners who want a lightweight, supportive shoe that straddles the line between training and racing.

SUPPORT AND CUSHION: Provides just the right amount of stability and support, great for overpronation while providing a lightweight, flexible and responsive cushioning. Ideal for road running, cross training, the gym or wherever you might want to take them! Predecessor: Ravenna 10
FAST CUSHIONING: BioMoGo DNA midsole cushioning and rebounding rubber deliver comfort without adding extra weight - perfect for days when you’re working on your speed.

HOLISTIC SUPPORT: We've shifted our focus beyond the feet to the most injury-prone part of a runner's body: the knees. GuideRails support keeps you moving comfortably by keeping excess movement in check.
QUICK TRANSITIONS: The Midfoot Transition Zone is shaped to go from heel to toe quickly.
